chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 72-year-old female with suspected drug-induced liver injury from Huzhang (Polygoni Cuspidati Rhizoma et Radix). Table 1 provides liver function indicators: ALT peaked at 479 U/L on April 3, AST peaked at 295 U/L on April 3, ALP peaked at 156 U/L on April 3, GGT peaked at 645 U/L on April 3, and total bilirubin (TBIL) peaked at 25.2 μmol/L on April 3. INR and albumin are not mentioned in the text. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged as the patient's liver function returned to normal after treatment, and she was discharged on April 14.
